text: Then Balaam said to Balak, &#34Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.&#34
Balak did as Balaam had said; and Balak and Balaam offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
Then Balaam said to Balak, &#34Stay here beside your burnt offerings while I go aside. Perhaps the LORD will come to meet me. Whatever he shows me I will tell you.&#34 And he went to a bare height.
Then God met Balaam; and Balaam said to him, &#34I have arranged the seven altars, and have offered a bull and a ram on each altar.&#34
The LORD put a word in Balaam&#39s mouth, and said, &#34Return to Balak, and this is what you must say.&#34
So he returned to Balak, who was standing beside his burnt offerings with all the officials of Moab.
Then Balaam uttered his oracle, saying: &#34Balak has brought me from Aram, the king of Moab from the eastern mountains: &#39Come, curse Jacob for me; Come, denounce Israel!&#39
How can I curse whom God has not cursed? How can I denounce those whom the LORD has not denounced?
For from the top of the crags I see him, from the hills I behold him; Here is a people living alone, and not reckoning itself among the nations!
Who can count the dust of Jacob, or number the dust-cloud of Israel? Let me die the death of the upright, and let my end be like his!&#34
Then Balak said to Balaam, &#34What have you done to me? I brought you to curse my enemies, but now you have done nothing but bless them.&#34
He answered, &#34Must I not take care to say what the LORD puts into my mouth?&#34
So Balak said to him, &#34Come with me to another place from which you may see them; you shall see only part of them, and shall not see them all; then curse them for me from there.&#34
So he took him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah. He built seven altars, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
Balaam said to Balak, &#34Stand here beside your burnt offerings, while I meet the LORD over there.
The LORD met Balaam, put a word into his mouth, and said, &#34Return to Balak, and this is what you shall say.&#34
When he came to him, he was standing beside his burnt offerings with the officials of Moab. Balak said to him, &#34What has the LORD said?&#34
Then Balaam uttered his oracle, saying: &#34Rise, Balak, and hear; listen to me, O son of Zippor:
God is not a human being, that he should lie, or a mortal, that he should change his mind. Has he promised, and will he not do it? Has he spoken, and will he not fulfill it?
See, I received a command to bless; he has blessed, and I cannot revoke it.
He has not beheld misfortune in Jacob; nor has he seen trouble in Israel. The LORD their God is with them, acclaimed as a king among them.
God, who brings them out of Egypt, is like the horns of a wild ox for them.
Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob, no divination against Israel; now it shall be said of Jacob and Israel, &#39See what God has done!&#39
Look, a people rising up like a lioness, and rousing itself like a lion! It does not lie down until it has eaten the prey and drunk the blood of the slain.&#34
Then Balak said to Balaam, &#34Do not curse them at all, and do not bless them at all.&#34
But Balaam answered Balak, &#34Did I not tell you, &#39Whatever the LORD says, that is what I must do&#39?&#34
So Balak said to Balaam, &#34Come now, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.&#34
So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.
Balaam said to Balak, &#34Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.&#34
So Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
